*Before attempting these questions, it is highly recommended that you read [Guide: The chain rule.](../studyguides/chainrule.qmd).*

Differentiate the following functions using the chain rule. 

1.1. $\quad \dfrac{1}{7}\cos(5+4x)$

1.2. $\quad 4\cos(x^2)$

1.3. $\quad e^{x^2 + 5}$

1.4. $\quad 2(\sin(2x))^2$

1.5. $\quad e^{\sin(3x)}$

1.6. $\quad \ln({{2+ 4x^{-2}})^{-1}}$

1.7. $\quad e^{5x^4}$ changed

1.8. $\quad e^{2x^{-3}}$ changed

1.9. $\quad -5\sqrt{x-2}$

1.10.  $\quad \sqrt{(x+3)^2}$

1.11. $\quad \ln (x^2 +1)$

1.12. $\quad \ln(\cos(x))$.

1.13. $\quad 2\cos^2(x)$.

1.14. $\quad 2(x^3 + 5x^2 + 13x -1)^3$.

1.15. $\quad \sqrt{\dfrac{1}{2x}}$.

1.16. $\quad \cos(5x^{-1/2})$. changed

1.17. $\quad \sin\left(\sqrt{x^2+1}\right)$

1.18. $\quad \sin(e^x)$

1.19. $\quad \cos(e^{-2x} + 5)$

1.20. $\quad \ln(3x^3 + \sin(x))$

---

[After attempting the questions above, please click this link to find the answers.](../answers/as-chainrule.qmd)
